subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China, the right component of this character is {{l|mul|𢀖}} (<big>⿱ス工</big>) which is the simplified component of {{l|mul|巠}}.
* In Taiwan (based on its encoding standard), Japanese {{w|shinjitai}} and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the right component of this character is {{l|mul|圣}} instead.
* Due to {{w|Han unification}}, both forms are encoded under the same [[code point]]. This character may appear to be either <font size=5, lang=zh-Hans>径</font> (mainland China) or <font size=5, lang=ja>径</font> (Taiwan/Japan/Korea) depending on the font used.

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|[[徑]]}} ''({{w|Traditional Chinese|Traditional form}} of ''<font size=4, lang=zh-Hans>径</font>'', {{w|kyūjitai}} form of ''<font size=4, lang=ja>径</font>)
* {{l|mul|[[逕]]}} ''({{w|Variant Chinese character|Variant}} {{w|Traditional Chinese|traditional form}} of {{l|mul|徑}} in mainland China)''
